intro: Moraea brevistyla subsp. brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
